intro: Orlowia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plants are native to various regions in Asia and are often found in moist, woodland habitats. Orlowia species usually have opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
